page.title: 07SHRIMP FISHING CONTINUED
page.content: Obviously the tractor can't operate in water this deep so they have a clever system which locks the trailers wheels in a straight line. The tractor then pulls at an angle, out of the main channel of water on the end of a hundred metres of rope, a bit like a barge on a canal. The tractors have platforms on the back and sides on which the catch is carried. They only work at low tide. It is a smelly job for them. In one catch they caught two and a half containers full. It was 80 pounds worth. When they go shrimp fishing the nets also catch crabs, sand-dabs, flukes and alsorts. They sort out the shrimps and put the other small fish back into the sea to let them grow. The shrimps have to be taken out of their shells before they can be sold.
